conclusion: The problem involves calculating the length of PM using principles of refraction in a transparent homogeneous optical element.
The refractive index of the element is given as n = 4/3, and the angle of incidence is α = 37°.
The angle of refraction θ can be calculated using the formula sin(θ) = n / (1 - n*sin(α)).
Substituting the values into the formula: sin(θ) = (4/3) / (1 - (4/3)*sin(37°)).
sin(37°) is approximated as 0.64, so sin(θ) = (4/3) / (1 - (4/3)*0.64).
The angle of incidence at point P is 90° - α = 90° - 37° = 53°.
The angle of refraction θ is calculated as 39.3°, so the complementary angle is 90° - 39.3° = 50.7°.
The length of PM is calculated using PM = L / sin(50.7°).
The length of PM is approximately 1.29L.
